publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1696 Rob Gibson: China and Dalai Lama Must Begin Talks—That the Parliament welcomes the decision of the European Parliament to support a resolution by the Greens/EFA group calling for opening of unconditional talks between China and the Dalai Lama on autonomy for Tibet; applauds the Cabinet Secretary for Education and Lifelong Learning, Fiona Hyslop MSP, on taking the opportunity at a recent meeting with Wu Qidi, Chinese vice minister of Education, to highlight the Scottish Government’s concerns about human rights in China, particularly in relation to the situation in Tibet; believes in the individual’s right to peaceful protest, and calls on the Chinese Government to immediately release Tibetan protesters still being held in custody.

S3M-1696 China and Dalai Lama Must Begin Talks (lodged on 11 April 2008) Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Alex Neil*, Bill Kidd*, Stuart McMillan*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bashir Ahmad*, Christina McKelvie*, Brian Adam*
S3M-1696 China and Dalai Lama Must Begin Talks (lodged on 11 April 2008) Roseanna Cunningham*, Mike Pringle*, Michael Matheson*, Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-1696 China and Dalai Lama Must Begin Talks (lodged on 11 April 2008) Dave Thompson*
